history.content:
There is not enough context to answer your question. What is your background? 

The department's strong guidance to *all* students is to take EE16A and EE16B. If you are going to take EECS 127, great. That's a core course. It builds off the material in EE16B and strengthens linear algebra and vector calculus while teaching you more optimization thinking. 

The only reason Math 54 is permitted for the L&S CS major is to catch special cases and exceptions without requiring petitions, etc. It is not a normal supported path. Everyone by default should be taking EE16A and then EE16B. Students who want to get more of the abstract axiomatic perspective on linear algebra are encouraged to take Math 110 *after* taking EE16A and EE16B. You will understand and appreciate this alternative perspective having built a solid intuition about $$R^n$$ and $$C^n$$ through EE16A and EE16B.

children.subject: Professor Sahai, thank you for your answer. I had another question: after having completed EE 16A and B, would you recommend a student take Math 110 first or EE 126 (assuming we're interested in both the topics covered in the courses)? I'll have completed CS 70 so I satisfy the requirements for either of them but since I'll be taking CS 61C in the semester as well, I can only take one of them. In your opinion, between 126 and 110, which would be the more preferred option to take first?

history.content:
Which of these schedules would be better?

- Math 54
- EECS 126

- Study extra LA topics for EECS 127

Fall 2019:
- EECS 127
- EE16A
